III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Two youth at the facility engaged in sexual touching on numerous
occasions.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator was interviewed via phone on August 22, 2024.
Administrator reported Youth C disclosed witnessing Youth A and
Youth B sexually touching one another on August 17, 2024. It is
unknown where staff were during the time this was occurring.
Administrator reported none of the youth involved are on heightened
supervision plans.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
23, 2024. Youth A reported he was involved in a strange incident
with Youth B over the weekend. He reported when they were out on
the soccer field, Youth B was asking Youth A if he was interested to
participating in inappropriate sexual things with him and he told him
no. Youth A would not elaborate more on what the “inappropriate
sexual things” were. Youth A reported over the weekend, when
sitting in the milieu, Youth B touched his penis for a couple of
seconds. He reported he was in shock that this occurred. Youth A
could not remember what day this occurred on but does remember
Staff 3 was in the kitchen cooking and another staff had just walked
away to open a door for another youth. He reported Youth B did this
at a time where staff were not paying attention and it happened for
less than 10 seconds. Youth A reported staff are always watching the
youth and making sure there is appropriate space between them. He
reported Youth B has also been telling a lie saying that he can see
into Youth A’s room. Youth A reported Youth B cannot see into his
room and denied ever showing his butt to Youth B through the
window. Youth A denied ever showing his penis to any youth at the
facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
23, 2024. Youth B reported he was involved in an incident with Youth
A over the weekend. He reported when they were out on the soccer
field, he asked Youth A if he was dating a female youth who lived in
2

another unit at the facility. Youth A denied dating anyone and asked
Youth B if he wanted to date him. Youth B reported Youth A then
asked to do “sexual stuff” and he refused to do anything because the
staff were watching. He reported when in the milieu area of the
facility he touched Youth A’s penis when staff were not watching.
Youth B could not remember what day this happened but
remembered that Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were working. He
reported he felt peer pressured into doing it and the incident occurred
for less than five minutes when staff were distracted. Youth B
reported he did not want to talk anymore about that incident because
he knew they were being sneaky and did not want to get into trouble.
He reported there was another incident, on an unknown date, when
he was in his bedroom looking out his window and saw Youth A
pushing his bare butt up to the window for Youth B to look at. Youth
B reported that he did not tell staff about these incidents. He reported
the staff at the facility do a good job at supervising the youth, but he
was sneaky with Youth A when he touched him.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
23, 2024. Youth C reported he told a staff, he could not remember
who, that Youth A showed his penis to Youth B and Youth C and
Youth B touched it. When asked about when this occurred, Youth C
reported that he believes it was Saturday, August 17, 2024. He
reported it was under a table when staff were not paying attention
and lasted less than five minutes. Youth C reported that staff are
always watching them and making sure there is space between the
youth. He reported Youth A and Youth B were sneaky and did it
when staff were distracted. Youth C stated he did not want to speak
about the situation anymore.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on August 23, 2024. Staff 1
reported he worked on Saturday, August 17, 2024. He reported he
did not witness any inappropriate interactions between Youth A and
Youth B. Staff 1 reported Youth A is typically vocal about not liking
Youth B. On Saturday though, Staff 1 had to redirect them for
whispering, and he made sure to inform Staff 2 and Staff 3 to be
more mindful of the two interactions. He reported when the youth
were sitting together, he made sure to be sitting in the same areas as
them and continue supervision. Staff 1 reported none of the youth
are on heightened supervision but due to their programming of
working with youth with sexual behaviors, it is important to always
maintain supervision of the youth and monitor conversations. He
reported within this program they do not allow couches but just
separate chairs to maintain appropriate space between one another.
Staff 1 reported when Staff 3 was making dinner, he noticed Youth B
was following around Youth A and redirected them to provide space
for one another. He reported he does not have any concerns about
the supervision levels his co-workers provide to the youth.
3

Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August 23,
2024. Staff 2 reported the youth like to push boundary lines at times
and staff have to always be maintaining supervision. He reported
Youth B has a history of trying to get Youth A in trouble. Staff 2
reported Youth B reported that he could see into Youth A’s bedroom
and Youth A was being inappropriate to him. He reported himself and
Supervisor walked into each of the youth’s rooms, and they could not
see one another from the rooms. Staff 2 reported that there were no
concerns of interactions between Youth A and Youth B on Saturday
August 17, 2024. He reported he was off the unit most of the day with
the other youth. Staff 2 reported staff are trained to always maintain
supervision of the youth within the milieu and room checks need to
be completed in variable intervals not to exceed fifteen minutes.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August 23,
2024. Staff 3 reported on Saturday, August 17, 2024, when he was
cooking dinner, he noticed Youth B was following Youth A around.
He reported earlier that day, Staff 1 told him to keep more of an eye
on the two youth because they were redirected for whispering. Staff 3
reported he did not notice any inappropriate behavior but wanted to
make sure that there was appropriate space between Youth A and
Youth B. He reported while he was cooking dinner, Staff 1 was
maintaining supervision of Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C in the
milieu area. Staff 3 reported when he was in the kitchen area, he was
able to supervise Youth A and Youth B while Staff 1 walked away
from the table with Youth C. He reported he was able to see Youth A
and Youth B from the kitchen cut out while they were at the table in
the milieu. Staff 3 reported he was trained that staff should always
maintain supervision of the youth when they are in the milieu and if
they are in their bedroom a room check needs to be completed in
variable intervals not to exceed fifteen minutes.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
23, 2024. Supervisor reported he was made aware of these concerns
when Youth C disclosed them to him. He reported when he asked
Youth B about the situation, he started to talk about how he could
see into Youth A’s bedroom when he was masturbating. Supervisor
reported this is not true as he tested it out with Staff 2. He explained
he stood in Youth A’s bedroom and Staff 2 stood in Youth B’s
bedroom and they could not see one another. Supervisor reported
that there was never a report of these concerns until Youth C
disclosed the concerns he saw, and Youth B wanted to place the
blame on Youth A for something.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of August 17, 2024, in the milieu area from 4pm-7pm
was reviewed on August 23, 2024, with Administrator. Video
4

recording from 4pm- 6:42pm showed no concerning interactions
between Youth A and Youth B. Most of their time was spent together
looking at cards and playing games with Youth C. Staff 1 and Staff 3
were seen sitting with the youth and interacting during this duration.
Staff 2 went into the kitchen area around 6:30pm and Staff 1 sat with
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C while they played a game at the
table. The table was in position to where staff could watch the youth
from the kitchen area as there is a cut out facing the milieu area. At
6:42pm Staff 1 got up to allow Youth C into the kitchen area and
Youth A and Youth B maintained playing the game. The kitchen area
does have a cut out for staff to maintain supervision and could see
Youth A and Youth B faces. Youth B looks over at the kitchen area
and slides his hand on to Youth A’s lap. Youth B removed his hand
within seconds and continues to look at the kitchen area. Staff 1 is
seen in the frame looking through the kitchen cut out area while
Youth C exits the kitchen. The three youth go back to playing their
game. Staff 1 comes back to the table around 6:44pm.
Documents reviewed:
-Policies/Procedures: Client Safety Policy (05-09) April 18, 2018.
This document indicates staff are to always keep youth safe and
secure while in care. Staff are also to adhere to this procedure and
implement specific supervision practices that are necessary.
- Policies/Procedures: Staff Raio Policy (04-01) July 13, 2024:
This document states direct care staff members are required to
maintain line-of-sight supervision of youth.
- Staff 1 Human Resource File- Staff 1 had no disciplinary actions
noted within his HR file. Staff 1 is up to date on all his required
training and completed a review in supervision requirements in
February 2024.
- Staff 2 Human Resource File- Staff 2 had no disciplinary actions
noted within his HR file. Staff 2 is up to date on all his required
training and completed a review in supervision requirements in June
2024.
- Staff 3 Human Resource File- Staff 3 had no disciplinary actions
noted within his HR file. Staff 3 is up to date on all his required
training and completed a review in supervision requirements in May
2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with staff following the
supervision policy. Within the review of the video there was a one
second of time where Youth B slid his hand under the table to
touch Youth A’s lap which was out of eyesight of staff. This event
occurred when Staff 1 was letting Youth C into the kitchen area
which Staff 3 was able to maintain visual contact of Youth A and
5

Youth B at the table. The youth noted within the interviews that
they were inappropriate when staff were not looking.
Technical Assistance:
Technical Assistance was offered to the facility to update their
staff ratio policy to be clear about staff supervision requirements
including defining what line-of-sight supervision.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
